hive_text_custom.text: : So Meg, I hear that you’re
baker. You like to bake brownies, cookies, things like that.
: Yeah. I love to bake. It’s pretty relaxing for me, and kind of fun, kind of a creative outlet, baking.
: Well, everybody notices it in the office when we see you bringing brownies for your students, and we’re all jealous. We wish we were in your class. So
baking? Like is it just something you do to relax?
: Yeah. Well personally, I love sweets. Like I would eat only sweets if my body could handle it.
: But I try to eat regular food, too. So I think I
that from my mom. So because I love sweet so much, it ends up being really fun making something like brownies or cookies.
And for the creative aspect, I love to make cupcakes or cakes and – I don’t know if you’ve heard of cake pops – and decorate them.

: No. What’s a cake pop? 
Meg: A cake pop is like a little piece of cake on a stick
: Oh really? That sounds pretty good.

: Yeah. So in America right now, they’re getting pretty popular. Some people are saying it’s the new cupcake. So I don’t know if you know, a few years back, cupcakes got pretty popular. And so now, we have cake pops. 
And I was in the process of starting a little cake pop business before I moved to Japan. So, it’s really fun because you can make the cake pops, and it takes a while but then you can decorate them in all these really creative ways for different holidays or parties or birthday or just cute things, so. Yeah, so the creativity plus something sweet makes it fun for me.
: That's awesome. But what – cake pop, is it like a corn dog but like a cake?
: No. It’s just like a little round piece of cake. So the process is you should bake a cake like normal.
: And then sift it up, so it’s just tiny little
. So ruin the cake that you’ve made, sift it up until it’s just crumbs and then mix in just a little bit of like cream cheese frosting. And it makes kind of a formable,

dough. And then you mold balls, put it on a stick, dip it chocolate, and then you can decorate it. 
So it can be chocolate or like a vanilla colored type, you know, you can have different colors, things like that.

: Yeah. Yeah. So cake pops are probably my favorite thing to make but also decorating cakes. I took a couple of cake decorating classes and making frosting and, you know, using the special frosting tools to swirl it on the cupcakes or whatever. So yeah.
: So have you ever made like a wedding cake or anything like that?

: I did actually make one wedding cake. I never really wanted to make wedding cakes because they’re very complicated and there’s so much pressure for it to be extremely perfect because it’s someone’s wedding.

: And so – but there was a couple that I knew who were just doing really like low-budget cute wedding, and they weren’t too concerned about it being a huge cake. They just need something smaller. 
And so, I did a couple of tiers and I was actually a chocolate cake. So it wasn’t even white. So I did one chocolate cake but I have a done cake pops for a few weddings as like favors for the guests.
: Wow. The cake pops are just the thing.

: Yeah, because they come out so cute. I actually have a cake pop set that I can make where it looks like a little bride and a little groom like a little tuxedo. And so those are probably my most popular ones for weddings. 
And I also, before cake pops, I was making truffles. So that’s another thing that you can also decorate in a cute way.
: Wow. Well, actually we’ll talk about that more in the next interview. I’d like to ask you some questions about truffles.

hive_lesson_quiz.question: 1)  Who does she make brownies for?
2) What are people calling cake pops?
3) How does baking cake pops make her feel?
4) What kind of course did she take?
5) How many times has she made a wedding cake?

hive_text_custom.text: If you say for example someone is quite the baker, that means you think or hear they are very good at baking. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
I hear she is quite the dancer.
 He is quite the singer.

hive_text_custom.text: We use this phrase to show we are interested but unclear about something. We usually follow this phrase with another question. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
What is it with yoga? Why do so many people love it?
 What is it with him? Why is he angry?

hive_text_custom.text: You can inherit money, customs and habits from your parents. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
He inherited his love of football from his dad.
 They inherited many traditions from their family.

hive_text_custom.text: A cake pop is coated in chocolate.
When you coat something, you cover it, usually with a pray or liquid. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
We coated the cookies in chocolate.
 They coated the strawberries in cream.

hive_text_custom.text: Crumbs are tiny pieces of bread or cakes. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
We fed the birds some crumbs.
 There are some crumbs on the floor.

hive_text_custom.text: And it makes kind of a formable,
When you mold something, you change the shape of it. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
They molded the clay into a vase.
 Most things must be wet in order to mold them.

with him? Why does he do that?
